title: Three Essential Steps for Women in Their Thirties to Become Millionaires
subtitle: A straightforward financial strategy to secure your wealth before your peers.
content:
Three Essential Steps for Women in Their Thirties to Become Millionaires

If you’re a woman in your thirties and want to become a millionaire before the finance bro in the office next to you, you need to do the following three things today.

I’m Tyler, a former financial advisor and portfolio manager. Now I make financial content for free so you don’t have to pay for it.

1. Commit to Your 401(k)

Commit to putting 15% of your paychecks into a 401(k). Men are told to contribute 10%, but you make less on average, spend 11.5 years out of the workforce to his 16 months, currently have less in your retirement accounts, and on average, live longer. It’s not fair, but it’s the facts.

2. Open a Roth IRA

Now open a Roth IRA through Fidelity, Schwab, or Vanguard and commit to funding that account with $50 a week, investing it in low-cost growth funds like Vanguard's VUG or Invesco's QQQM. You now own pieces of the world's most profitable companies, and three decades of potential growth will be 100% tax-free.

3. Open a Brokerage Account

Finally, open a brokerage account through the same firm and contribute and invest another $50 a week in low-cost index funds like Vanguard's VOO or Fidelity's FXAIX. Why contribute to this alongside a 401(k) and a Roth IRA? Because now you have a pre-tax account for tax advantages now, a post-tax account for tax advantages later, and a brokerage account for flexibility and accessibility always. That’s what millionaires do.

Conclusion

If any of this is helpful, sign up for my free weekly newsletter by clicking the link in my bio, and each week, I’ll send you over another money playbook that actually works.
